abstracts.cdata!:
The outcome of the Fourth Dhaka Water
            Supply Project for Bangladesh was unsatisfactory, the
            sustainability was unlikely, the institutional development
            impact was modest, and the Bank and the borrower performance
            were both unsatisfactory. This project has been
            unsuccessful, it provides a number of opportunities to
            consider what lessons can be learned. Policy and
            institutional changes should be demonstrated in advance of
            making large investments. Intense supervision should be
            directed mainly at institutional development objectives.
            Consideration of using other instruments, such as
            introducing key requirements into a Sector Adjustment Loan,
            could have helped obtain the type of major policy change
            required. It is essential that supervision, by the borrower
            and lender, ensures that the agreements are strictly
            honored. Comments by Dhaka Water Supply and Sewerage
            Authority stress the importance of high-level monitoring of
            progress by its own Ministry, to highlight areas where
            delays occur.

repnme.cdata!: Bangladesh - Fourth Dhaka Water Supply Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The basic objectives of the Fourth Dhaka
            Water Supply Project are: a) to commence an institutional
            reform program; b) to increase the life of existing assets
            and reduce water losses; c) strengthen water resources
            management; and d) to increase potable water supply.  The
            project will include major elements as follows: a)
            institutional reform program; b) capacity additions and
            service extensions; c) loss reduction, sanitation and
            efficiency improvement activities; d) institutional
            development technical assistance; and e) project preparation
            and implementation support technical assistance.
